lines.text: What made you suspect they are Russian spies?
I deduced it, sir.
From what?
From the cook, sir.
What did the cook say?
That they were Russian spies.
A clever deduction.
What has Miss Lipp to say? Did you hear her talk to anyone?
Yes, I heard her speak to Mr. Harper.
What did she say?
Personal things, you know, I don't think they'd be of any interest to you.
*Everything* she says is of interest to me.
Well, she said I was attractive to her.
Fool! She knew you were listening!
That's impossible.
Then why would she say anything so stupid!
Well, she did! She even went further. She said I had beautiful eye lashes!

[advising Major Tufan of Simpson's criminal record]
In 1958 he was deported from Britain for smuggling pornographic literature.
An art magazine, sir!
Called...?
'Stop Press Nudes'!
[first lines]
It can be done! That's the way it can be done! Aaah... oh, excuse me; I've just had a great idea - something I've been looking for a long time... a very long time.
[last lines]
There's a secret stairway in the Kremlin - the Romanov jewels...
And where do we find these lily-white innocents?
It's not a question of losing my nerve; I never *had* nerve!
[Simpson is talking to the Turkish guards who have arrested him]

You frighten me, sir. But, after all, that's part of your job. But if my father could hear you now he'd laugh himself sick. He wasn't no colonel, sir. I just said that in order to make myself seem important. He was a sergeant - acting sergeant - acting unpaid sergeant. And d'you know what he used to say to me? He used to say, "Arthur"... he used to call me Arthur... "Arthur, you're a carbuncle on the behind of humanity." Carbuncle! I'm a nothing! I'm a nobody!
Do you mind that I am a nymphomaniac?
It's your most endearing quality.
Don't waste it - use it.
Giulio's on the sill now. I'll help you lower him down.
Can't he do anything by himself?
I'm beginning to wonder if anything is real.
You foreign, eh?
No,I'm English.
